intro: Dimorphanthes chinensis, commonly known as the Chinese dimorphanthus, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and produces small, hairy leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in clusters, making it an ornamental plant in some regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare species in its native range.
